Subjects: creed, Apostles’; faith, articles of; heaven, joys of; songs
_description: A statement of belief and assurance of the bliss that is its reward — ten lines in a cross-rhymed quatrain (perhaps the burden?) and a tail-rhymed 6-line stanza

CULAdd5943.Transcription:
[C]redo in deum  þat y[s] withowt begynnyng and
                    endeþat made heuene & erþe and al þat yshym feyful
                    we scolde euer more in myndffor he ywys bryng vs to parfyth blys
                    blysall owre lyfi ys me gud wyt woWere so heuen þat we goWyl
                    we buyþ in þys ledBot in god al on I wysþer nys no ful
                    parfyt blysho so tak ryȝt god heed
